conbody.p: Hadoop FS destinationgenerating record header attributesrecord header attributesgeneratingLocal FS destinationgenerating record header attributesMapR FS destinationrecord header attributesdestinationsgenerating record header attributes for record based writesYou can use the Hive Metadata processor or the Expression Evaluator to generate record header attributes for record-based writes.

To use the Expression Evaluator, you must generate record header attributes as expected by the destination. Use the following guidelines to generate record header attributes with the Expression Evaluator:
Generating the target directory with the Expression Evaluator When using the Expression Evaluator to generate the target directory, note the following details:
The destination expects the directory in a header attribute named "targetDirectory".
The destination uses the directory exactly as written in the targetDirectory header attribute. Unlike directory templates, the directory specified in the targetDirectory attribute should not include any components that require evaluation, such as constants, variables, or runtime properties.
When you define the expression that evaluates to a directory, you can use any valid component, including expressions that evaluate data in the record.
For example, you want to write records to different directories based on the that runs the pipeline, and the region and store ID where the transaction took place. You can set up a runtime resource named DIR that defines the base for the directory and define DIR for each that runs the pipeline. Then, you can use the following expression in the Expression Evaluator to define the targetDirectory attribute: ${runtime:conf('DIR')/transactions/${record.value('/region')}/${record.value('/storeID')}
Generating the Avro schema with the Expression Evaluator When using the Expression Evaluator to generate the Avro schema, note the following details:
The destination expects the Avro schema in a header attribute named "avroSchema".
Use the standard Avro schema format, for example: {"type":"record","name":"table_name","namespace":"database_name", "fields":[{"name":"int_val","type":["null","int"],"default":null}, {"name":"str_val","type":["null","string"],"default":null}]}
The database name and table name must be included in the Avro schema.
You might use an Avro schema generator to help generate the Avro schema.
Generating the roll attribute with the Expression Evaluator When using the Expression Evaluator to generate the roll attribute, note the following details:
Use any name for the attribute and specify the attribute name in the destination.
Configure an expression that defines when to roll files.Tech review: Do we want to say something like: Typically you want to roll files when â€¦ (the schema changes? something else? ) And do we want to offer a example of an expression that could work?

To define a record header attribute in the Expression Evaluator, perform the following steps:
On the Expressions tab of the Expression Evaluator, specify the Header Attribute name.
To generate a target directory, use targetDirectory.
To generate an Avro schema, use avroSchema.
You can use any name for a roll indicator header attribute.
For the Header Attribute Expression, define the expression that evaluates to the information you want the destination to use.
